title: Mountain Trekking in the Atlas Mountains
description: Join us for a challenging mountain trek through the stunning Atlas Mountains in Morocco and summit the highest peak in North Africa. This trek is perfect for those who want to experience the beauty of the Atlas Mountains and the rich culture of Morocco. We will spend 4 days trekking through the mountains, passing through small villages and enjoying the breathtaking views. The trek is led by an experienced mountain guide who will ensure your safety and comfort throughout the trip. This trek is suitable for those with a good level of fitness and some hiking experience.

activities.name: Skiing
activities.description: Skiing can be a means of transport, a recreational activity or a competitive winter sport in which the participant uses skis to glide on snow. Many types of competitive skiing events are recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC), and the International Ski Federation (FIS).

activities.name: Hiking
activities.description: Hiking is a long, vigorous walk, usually on trails or footpaths in the countryside. Walking for pleasure developed in Europe during the eighteenth century. Religious pilgrimages have existed much longer but they involve walking long distances for a spiritual purpose associated with specific religions.

activities.name: Trekking
activities.description: Trekking is a form of walking, undertaken with the specific purpose of exploring and enjoying the scenery. It usually takes place on trails in areas of relatively unspoiled wilderness.

activities.name: Climbing
activities.description: Climbing is the activity of using one's hands, feet, or any other part of the body to ascend a steep object. It is done recreationally, competitively, in trades that rely on it, and in emergency rescue and military operations. It is done indoors and out, on natural and manmade structures.

activities.name: Mountaineering
activities.description: Mountaineering is the set of activities that involves ascending mountains. Mountaineering-related activities include traditional outdoor climbing, skiing, and traversing via ferratas. Indoor climbing, sport climbing and bouldering are also considered mountaineering by some.

notices.name: Altitude sickness is a risk at high elevations.
The trek can be physically demanding.

take_into_account.name: Bring warm clothing as temperatures can drop significantly at high elevations.
Bring sunscreen and a hat to protect from the sun.

guide.name: Rime Machiche
guide.title: Mountain Guide
guide.bio: I am an experienced mountain guide with over 10 years of experience leading treks in the Atlas Mountains. I am passionate about sharing my love of the mountains with others and helping them discover the beauty of Morocco. I speak English, French, and Arabic fluently and have extensive knowledge of the local culture and history. I look forward to welcoming you to Morocco and showing you the best of the Atlas Mountains!

reviews.comment: Rime was a great mountain guide. He was very patient and helped me learn how to climb in no time. I would definitely recommend him to anyone looking for a mountain guide in Morocco!
Rime was a great mountain guide. He was very patient and helped me learn how to climb in no time. I would definitely recommend him to anyone looking for a mountain guide in Morocco!
Rime was a great mountain guide. He was very patient and helped me learn how to climb in no time. I would definitely recommend him to anyone looking for a mountain guide in Morocco!

destination.label: Mount Toubkal
destination.description: Mount Toubkal is the highest peak in the Atlas Mountains and North Africa. It is located in Toubkal National Park, about 60 km south of Marrakesh. The mountain is a popular destination for trekkers and climbers due to its accessibility and stunning views. The summit offers panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. The mountain is also home to a variety of wildlife, including Barbary sheep, wild boar, and the endangered Barbary macaque.

local_customs: Respect local traditions and dress modestly. Haggling is a common practice in markets.

steps.label: Marrakesh to Imlil
steps.description: On the first day, we will drive from Marrakesh to Imlil, a small village at the base of Mount Toubkal. We will spend the night in a traditional Moroccan guesthouse in Imlil.

steps.label: Imlil to Toubkal Base Camp
steps.description: On the second day, we will begin our hike to Toubkal Base Camp. The hike takes about 6 hours and passes through small villages and beautiful landscapes. We will spend the night in a tent at the base camp.

steps.label: Toubkal Base Camp to Summit
steps.description: On the third day, we will wake up early to begin our ascent to the summit of Mount Toubkal. The hike to the summit takes about 4-5 hours. We will enjoy the breathtaking views from the summit before descending back to Toubkal Base Camp

steps.label: Back to Imlil
steps.description: On the third day, we will descend back to Imlil. The descent takes about 4 hours. We will spend the night in a traditional Moroccan guesthouse in Imlil.

steps.label: Day 4: Imlil to Marrakesh
steps.description: On the fourth and final day, we will drive back to Marrakesh. The drive takes about 2 hours. The trip ends upon arrival in Marrakesh.

meetingPoint.instructions: We will meet at the main entrance...

user_reviews.comment: This trekking experience was unforgettable! The guide was knowledgeable and the scenery was breathtaking. Highly recommend!
Great experience overall. The food could have been better, but the trek itself was amazing!
Absolutely loved it! The guide, the trek, the landscapes – everything was top-notch!

title: Desert Camel Safari in the Sahara Desert
description: Embark on a memorable journey through the vast Sahara Desert in Morocco, experiencing the golden dunes and the starry nights...

notices.name: Be prepared for high daytime temperatures.
Nights can get chilly, so bring warm clothing.

take_into_account.name: Bring enough water to stay hydrated.
Wear comfortable clothing and shoes suitable for desert terrain.

guide.name: Sarah Alizadeh
guide.bio: An experienced desert guide with over 8 years in the Sahara, ensuring safety and unforgettable memories...

destination.label: Sahara Desert
destination.description: The Sahara Desert is the world's largest hot desert, offering mesmerizing dunes and unique experiences...

steps.label: Day 1: Merzouga to Sahara Desert Camp
steps.description: Start the journey from Merzouga on camels, heading to a desert camp while experiencing the vastness of the desert. Camp under the starry sky.

steps.label: Day 2: Explore Sahara
steps.description: Explore the beauty of the desert, go dune bashing and experience local Berber culture. Stay another night under the stars.

steps.label: Day 3: Return to Merzouga
steps.description: Return to Merzouga from the desert camp on camels, marking the end of the desert expedition.

title: Akchour Waterfalls Hiking Adventure
description: Embark on a memorable hiking journey to the breathtaking Akchour Waterfalls in the heart of the Rif Mountains, near the enchanting city of Chefchaouen, Morocco. This trek is perfect for nature lovers and adventurers seeking to explore the serene beauty of Akchour's landscapes. The trek spans 3 days, leading you through lush green valleys, along river trails, and to the majestic waterfalls. It's guided by a local expert familiar with the area's flora and fauna.

notices.name: Be prepared for varying weather conditions.
Some trails may be challenging for beginners.

take_into_account.name: Bring a camera for stunning landscape photography.
Pack light but include essential gear for overnight stays.

guide.name: Amina El Fassi
guide.bio: I am a local hiking guide with over 8 years of experience leading expeditions in the Rif Mountains. My love for nature and the outdoors drives my passion for guiding adventurers through some of Morocco's most scenic trails. I am fluent in English, Spanish, and Arabic, and have deep knowledge of the region's cultural and natural history.

destination.label: Akchour Waterfalls
destination.description: The Akchour Waterfalls are a hidden gem located in the Rif Mountains near Chefchaouen. These cascading waterfalls offer a stunning natural retreat with lush vegetation, diverse wildlife, and crystal-clear pools perfect for swimming. The area provides a tranquil escape from the bustling city life and is a paradise for hikers and nature enthusiasts.

local_customs: Respect the natural surroundings and local wildlife.
Be mindful of local cultural norms and traditions.

steps.label: Chefchaouen to Akchour
steps.description: We'll start our journey from the charming city of Chefchaouen to the village of Akchour. After settling in, we'll enjoy a brief orientation walk around the village.

steps.label: Akchour Village to Waterfalls
steps.description: Embark on the trail leading to the Akchour Waterfalls. The hike, covering scenic landscapes and natural pools, takes approximately 4 hours. There will be opportunities for swimming and photography.

steps.label: Exploration and Return
steps.description: Spend the morning exploring the area around the waterfalls, enjoying the serene environment. After lunch, we'll begin our return journey to Akchour Village, followed by transportation back to Chefchaouen.

includes: Transport from Chefchaouen to Akchour and back

meetingPoint.instructions: Participants will gather at the Central Plaza in Chefchaouen. Look for the guide holding a sign with 'Akchour Hiking Adventure' written on it. Please be there 15 minutes prior to departure for a brief introduction and to answer any last-minute questions.

user_reviews.comment: This trekking experience was unforgettable! The guide was knowledgeable and the scenery was breathtaking. Highly recommend!
Great experience overall. The food could have been better, but the trek itself was amazing!
Absolutely loved it! The guide, the trek, the landscapes – everything was top-notch!

title: Taghazout Surfing Expedition
description: Dive into the world of surfing with our exclusive Taghazout Surfing Expedition. Renowned for its consistent surf breaks, Taghazout offers an ideal setting for both beginners and seasoned surfers. Over 5 days, you'll get to experience various famous surf spots, learn from experienced instructors, and immerse yourself in the laid-back surf culture. The package includes daily surf lessons, equipment rental, and plenty of time to catch the perfect waves.

notices.name: Be prepared for sun exposure and physical activity.

take_into_account.name: Bring a water bottle to stay hydrated.
Respect local surf etiquette and safety rules.

guide.name: Youssef Elouahabi
guide.bio: I'm Youssef, a professional surf instructor with over 12 years of experience in the waters of Taghazout. My goal is to share the thrill of surfing with enthusiasts from all over the world. Fluent in English, French, and Arabic, I specialize in helping beginners find their confidence on the board and guiding experienced surfers to new challenges.

destination.label: Taghazout Beaches
destination.description: Taghazout is a picturesque surf village known for its epic waves and vibrant surf culture. Located along Morocco's southwest coast, the area boasts a variety of surf spots suitable for all levels. From the gentle rollers perfect for beginners to the challenging tubes for the pros, Taghazout is a surfer's paradise.

local_customs: Respect the local surf culture and prioritize safety.
Support local businesses and be mindful of the environment.

steps.label: Introduction to Surfing in Taghazout
steps.description: Begin your surfing adventure with an introduction session on the basics of surfing. This includes understanding surf safety, board dynamics, and initial practice on the beach. The day ends with a relaxing yoga session to stretch out and prepare for the next day.

steps.label: First Surf in the Ocean
steps.description: Take your newly learned skills to the ocean. Start with small waves, guided by the instructor. The afternoon session focuses on improving techniques and enjoying the surf. The day winds down with a group dinner and surf theory discussion.

steps.label: Exploring Different Surf Spots
steps.description: Discover various surf spots around Taghazout, each offering different wave types. This is a day to explore and challenge your surfing skills under the watchful eye of your instructor. End the day with a sunset yoga session.

steps.label: Advanced Surfing Techniques
steps.description: Focus on advanced surfing techniques and maneuvering. Participants can practice turning and riding larger waves. The day includes personal feedback sessions to enhance individual skills, followed by a group barbecue in the evening.

steps.label: Freestyle Surfing and Closing Ceremony
steps.description: The final day is for freestyle surfing, allowing participants to showcase their skills. The expedition concludes with a closing ceremony, certificate distribution for participants, and a farewell lunch.

title: Ouzoud Waterfalls Kayaking Adventure
description: Experience the beauty of the Ouzoud Waterfalls from a unique perspective with our exclusive kayaking adventure. The Ouzoud Waterfalls are the highest waterfalls in Morocco, cascading over 100 meters into the El Abid River. This 3-day expedition takes you on a kayaking journey through the river, allowing you to explore the waterfalls and surrounding landscapes. The package includes kayaking equipment, accommodation, and meals.

notices.name: Be prepared for sun exposure and physical activity.

take_into_account.name: Bring a water bottle to stay hydrated.
Respect local safety rules and regulations.

guide.name: Mohamed El Kaddouri
guide.bio: I'm Mohamed, a professional kayaking guide with over 10 years of experience leading expeditions in the Ouzoud Waterfalls. My goal is to share the thrill of kayaking with enthusiasts from all over the world. Fluent in English, French, and Arabic, I specialize in helping beginners find their confidence on the water and guiding experienced kayakers to new challenges.

reviews.comment: This kayaking experience was unforgettable! The guide was knowledgeable and the scenery was breathtaking. Highly recommend!
Great experience overall. The food could have been better, but the kayaking itself was amazing!
Absolutely loved it! The guide, the kayaking, the landscapes – everything was top-notch!

destination.label: Ouzoud Waterfalls
destination.description: The Ouzoud Waterfalls are the highest waterfalls in Morocco, cascading over 100 meters into the El Abid River. The area offers a variety of activities, including kayaking, swimming, and hiking. The waterfalls are surrounded by lush vegetation and diverse wildlife, making it a popular destination for nature enthusiasts.

steps.label: Introduction to Kayaking
steps.description: Begin your kayaking adventure with an introduction session on the basics of kayaking. This includes understanding river safety, boat dynamics, and initial practice on the water. The day ends with a relaxing yoga session to stretch out and prepare for the next day.

steps.label: Kayaking to the Waterfalls
steps.description: Take your newly learned skills to the river. Start with small rapids, guided by the instructor. The afternoon session focuses on improving techniques and enjoying the water. The day winds down with a group dinner and kayaking theory discussion.

meetingPoint.instructions: Participants will gather at the Ouzoud Waterfalls. Look for the guide holding a sign with 'Ouzoud Kayaking Adventure' written on it. Please be there 15 minutes prior to departure for a brief introduction and to answer any last-minute questions.

user_reviews.comment: This kayaking experience was unforgettable! The guide was knowledgeable and the scenery was breathtaking. Highly recommend!
Great experience overall. The food could have been better, but the kayaking itself was amazing!
Absolutely loved it! The guide, the kayaking, the landscapes – everything was top-notch!
